availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: A. Scott McGrorty (Boyle County, Kentucky, druggist)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, druggist. Native of Ireland. Married to Rosa B. Yeiser McGrorty. Father of Mary J. McGrorty, Rosa E. McGrorty, Alex Scott McGrorty, Lucy B. McGrorty, Alice McGrorty, and Clara McGrorty. Druggist in Boyle County in 1850. Employed William M. Stout as a druggist in Boyle County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850. Druggist in Boyle County in 1860. Employed Thomas M. Green as a clerk in Boyle County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1860. Household owned one additional enslaved person in Boyle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 355B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 584, p. 7 of 29 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 900.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, p. 166A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 165A.
Find A Grave, "Capt Alexander Scott McGrorty (1820-1915)," Memorial #45344080, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/45344080 (accessed September 11, 2020).
